page.title: 12Barkestone colloquialisms
page.content: A cob is a small roll. To make the fire means to make a fire Mardy means being sulky and is usually about a person especially a child. A jitty is a small footpath. The back-end is the autumn. Nesh means to feel the cold A pykelett is a crumpet. Punks are young people who dress brightly and put jel on their hair to make it stand up. Mods are a group of people who wear union jacks on their clothes. To be trendy is to wear fashionable clothes. Ace is a slang word for good. A pop group is a group of people who play instruments or sing. A disco is a sort of party where you dance to music. Robotics means dancing like a robot.
